results.title: Suddenly [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Lewis Allen, Robert Bassler and Libra Productions
results.brief_description: Set in a sleepy US town by the name of “Suddenly”, an attractive war widow and mother of young son “Pidge” is pursued by the local sheriff Todd Shaw (Sterling Hayden) with romance in mind. Todd gets word that the President of the United States is to make an impromptu visit to the town and the FBI arrive to set up a secure perimeter around the railway station. Overlooking the station is the home of the widow Ellen (Nancy Gates) and her father-in-law (James Gleason), an ex-secret service agent. The film becomes a hostage drama as three gangsters lead by John Barron (Frank Sinatra) attempt to assassinate the president with a rifle from the house on the hill. The film provides a commentary on the role of the hand-gun in a post-world war America. Because of the similarity of the plot to real life, the film was withdrawn from general distribution after the assassination of JFK. Part of a two-disc set, with one disc being an Audio CD. Also contains a booklet with information and photos of Frank Sinatra.

results.title: The Brain eaters
results.creator_credit: Bruno VeSota, Edwin Nelson and American International Pictures (AIP)
results.brief_description: Crawling, slimy things terror-bent on destroying the world! So runs the tagline for “The Brain eaters”, classic B-grade science fiction about a mysterious alien structure found jutting out of the earth, in small-town USA. After some studious investigating, a senator and a doctor discover that aliens have infiltrated and are controlling the townsfolk. The terror of a mind-controlling alien threat and subsequent loss of governmental power operates as an analogy for the fear of Communist invasion and the accusations of brainwashing that were likened to the “Red threat”.

results.title: The Shaggy dog
results.creator_credit: Charles Barton, Bill Walsh, Walt Disney and Walt Disney Productions
results.brief_description: Family comedy film around the theme of fantasy and magic. The discovery of a magic ring changed young Wilby Daniels’ (Tommy Kirk) life forever. Suddenly he could transform himself into a large sheepdog - but the problem was he had no control as to when this was going to happen. Wilby did not need this in his life right now, just when he had his eye on the rather pretty Allison (Annette Funicello). He had to break the spell and the only way to do that was by performing some virtuous deed. Cast also includes Fred MacMurray, Jean Hagen, Tim Considine.

results.title: The Shaggy D.A.
results.creator_credit: Robert Stevenson, Bill Anderson and Walt Disney Productions
results.brief_description: Sequel to Disney’s “The Shaggy Dog” (released 17 years earlier), this family comedy is full of slapstick moments and a plot that takes you from the world of reality to the fantastic and bizarre. Dean Jones stars as the now grown-up Wilby Daniels, who is campaigning to become a district attorney and Keenan Wynn plays his villainous arch-rival, John Slade. The campaign is turned on its head when Daniels is transformed into a sheepdog and Slade into a disgruntled bulldog and it becomes a contest between the two canines. Cast also includes Tim Conway, Suzanne Pleshette, Jo Ann Worley.

results.title: The Lickerish quartet
results.brief_description: This erotic fantasy film is set in an ancient Italian castle where a man and woman live with her adult son. Opening with the family viewing a pornographic movie and commenting on it, the trio then venture out to the local carnival where they meet the star of the movie now working as a motorcycle stuntwoman. They invite the woman back to the house to have a ‘party’ and watch the film together. Bizarrely she is no longer in the film and has been replaced. One by one the mysterious blonde seduces each of the family members resulting a sexual awakening for all of them, until in the end, physical reality is lost to them and they too become part of movie for others to watch. Highly stylised sets, costumes and funky music add to the swinging sixties feel of this Radley Metzger fantasy romp. Based on the story “Hide and Seek” by Michael De Forrest and Radley Metzger. Cast includes Silvana Venturelli, Frank Wolff, Erika Remberg, Paolo Turco.

results.title: Unidentified flying oddball
results.creator_credit: Russ Mayberry, Ron Miller and Walt Disney Productions
results.brief_description: Based on Mark Twain’s ‘A Connecticut Yankee in King Arthur’s Court’ this Disney film version provides a new twist to the story by setting it in today’s space age. NASA scientist Tom Trimble (Dennis Dugan) and his robot clone accidentally find themselves travelling back in time to the land of merry England and the court of King Arthur (Kenneth More). Here Trimble encounters the lovely Alisande (Sheila White), King Arthur’s enemy the evil knight Sir Mordred (Jim Dale), and Merlin (Ron Moody) the Court’s magician. Will Trimble be drawn into Sir Mordred’s evil plot to oust King Arthur or will he save the day and in doing so stop history from being changed forever? Cast includes John Le Mesurier as Sir Gawain.

results.title: Yojimbo [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Akira Kurosawa and Toho Kabushiki Kaisha
results.brief_description: A fine film by Kurosawa, in which a wandering samurai exploits two gangs who are fighting for control of a village. Very much a tongue-in-cheek samurai film, with Toshiro Mifune quite superb as the warrior who teaches both warring factions a lesson. Reverred for its black humour and technical mastery, “Yojimbo”, like many of Kurosawa’s works, was later remade — by Sergio Leone, as “A fistful of dollars”. Also available on VHS [301894].

results.title: Holy man
results.creator_credit: Stephen Herek, Roger Birnbaum and Touchstone Pictures
results.brief_description: An examination and re-evaluation of morals and ethics drives this comedy/drama about a television executive and a marketing manager who despite loathing each other, must work together. The two identify their misguided paths assisted by an enigmatic character named ‘G’, who seems to possess miraculous powers. Stars Eddie Murphy (as G), Jeff Goldblum and Kelly Preston.

results.title: The Adventures of Huck Finn
results.creator_credit: Stephen Sommers, Laurence Mark and Walt Disney Pictures
results.brief_description: Film adaptation of the classic 19th century novel ‘The Adventures of Huckleberry Finn’ by American writer, Mark Twain. This is a story about Huck Finn (Elijah Wood), a poor uneducated boy who has run away from home to escape his abusive drunken father, and Huck’s chance encounter with Jim (Courtney S. Vance), an escaped slave. Together the two follow the Mississippi River finding adventure and drama and some rather dubious characters by the names of the King (Jason Robards) and the Duke (Robbie Coltrane). Cast also includes Ron Perlman and Laura Bundy.

results.title: JSA: Joint security area
results.creator_credit: Park Chan-Wook, Lee Eun, Myung Film, KTB Network and CJ Entertainment
results.brief_description: Powerful anti-war drama about an enquiry into the killing of two North Korean soldiers by a South Korean soldier on border patrol. Brought in to stifle a potentially incendiary situation, independent investigating officer Sophie Jean discovers that the group were once unlikely friends, sharing card games and good times. But subsequent enquiries reveal inconsistent versions of the tragic events that followed. A huge hit in Korea and Japan, “JSA” is a humanistic and sensitive examination of the discord between army officialdom and friendships amid supposed enemies. Adapted from the novel by Park Sang-myeon.
